s0001: The ancestors of Qin were descendants of Emperor Zhuanxu, a remote grandson named Nüxiu.
s0002: Nüxiu was weaving when a dark bird dropped an egg; Nüxiu swallowed it and gave birth to a son named Daye.
s0003: Daye married the daughter of Shaodian, named Nühua.
s0004: Nühua gave birth to Da Fei, who helped Yu control the floods.
s0005: When this was accomplished, the emperor bestowed a black jade tablet.
s0006: Yu accepted it saying: 'It was not my ability alone that accomplished this; Da Fei was my assistant.'
s0007: Emperor Shun said: 'Ah, Fei, you aided Yu's achievements. I grant you a black banner.
s0009: He married him to a jade maiden of the Yao clan.
s0010: Da Fei bowed and accepted, assisted Shun in taming birds and beasts, and many birds and beasts became tame. This was Bai Yi.
s0013: One descendant was Zhongyan, who was in charge of raising horses for the Xia.
s0014: During the time of Jie, Zhongyan's descendants split into two branches.
s0015: One branch was the ancestor of Zhao, the other the ancestor of Qin.
s0016: The ancestor of Qin was Feilian.
s0040: Shi was the one who assisted the Zhou destroy Yin.
